title: Is it possible to live without full-time work? - Quora

So if you want to be stuck with your life for 42 years don't work. Otherwise sign up with the man and they will let you keep your IPhone 53 plus when you retire at sixty five.

I think that it is possible to live a life without working full-time because I did it for years. But that wasn’t out of choice, that was because I was laid off every year for six years. I did not in that time have a profession and so I hadn’t saved much money. But people who know me are amazed on how little I can live from. To live on little means that I didn’t smoke, drink, dine out more than once a year, buy many new clothes, travel, invest. Honestly. Was I happy-not really, but I did it. But my unhappiness had to do with my outlook and not my lack of funds. But did I want new experiences that only money could buy, yes. Mostly travelling. And I became very anxious and worried because my employment situation wasn’t getting better and I was getting older. I think you can live if you have a sufficient amount of savings to last a life-time, but without it, I am doubtful that you can live without a fulltime job or very well-paying part-time job because the cost of living keeps going up and PT work isn’t easy to live on.
